page.title: 18Early Flight - Eastchurch
page.content: The Short Brothers and the Aero Club moved from Leysdown and Shellbeach respectively to a permanent place at Eastchurch. The site was to the south of Eastchurch station on the Sheppey Light Railway line. In 1911, one of the{armed {forces,}the Royal Naval Aviation School was established on a part of the Aero Club's grounds. The pioneers of aviation obtained pilot licences at Eastchurch {Aerodrome}two notable names being Lord Brabazon of Tara and Sir Winston Churchill. A stone memorial erected in memory of early aviators stands opposite the church in the centre of the{village.}A stained glass window to Cecil Grace and C.S. Rolls who died in an air tragedy can be seen in All Saints{Church.
